item.title: Nurul add a quote by Michael Crichton
item.description: "Do you know what we call opinion in the absence of evidence? We call it prejudice." -- Michael Crichton

item.title: Nurul add a quote by Aldo Leopold
item.description: "Conservation is getting nowhere because it is incompatible with our Abrahamic concept of land. We abuse land because we regard it as a commodity belonging to us. When we see land as a community to which we belong, we may begin to use it with love and respect." -- Aldo Leopold

item.title: Nurul add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "Everyone thinks of changing the world, but no one thinks of changing himself." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Nurul add a quote by William Beebe
item.description: "……but work in the field has nothing to do with dignity or with anything except patience, concentration, and eternal vigilance" -- William Beebe

item.title: Nurul add a quote by Jules Verne
item.description: "Science, my lad, is made up of mistakes, but they are mistakes which it is useful to make, because they lead little by little to the truth." -- Jules Verne

item.title: Nurul add a quote by Yann Martel
item.description: "I challenge anyone to understand Islam, its spirit, and not to love it. It is a beautiful religion of brotherhood and devotion." -- Yann Martel

item.title: Nurul add a quote by Hedy Lamarr
item.description: "Any girl can be glamorous. All you have to do is stand still and look stupid." -- Hedy Lamarr
